definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Leave it on her bedside table when you head to work.
sentences.chinese: 摆在她的床头柜，好让她在你上班的时候也能看到你。

sentences.english: The deluxe bed table is also great for hobbies such as doing jig saw puzzles.
sentences.chinese: 豪华的床头柜也做夹具，如发现有爱好大难题。

sentences.english: Put the other roses in a vase on the nightstand.
sentences.chinese: 将其他的玫瑰放在床头柜的花瓶中。

sentences.english: If you want to put photos in the bedroom, put small pictures on the night stand next to your bed.
sentences.chinese: 如果想在卧室放照片，可以在床头柜旁放上小照片。

sentences.english: I went down the hill to buy some apples and pears and left these on the bedside cupboard. She had never produced a baby.
sentences.chinese: 我下山去买了苹果和梨子放在她的床头柜上。

sentences.english: He grabbed his wallet from the bedside table and stuffed it deep in his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 他从床头柜上抓起了钱包，塞到口袋里去。

sentences.english: His eyes focused now on a crumpled flyer on his bedside table.
sentences.chinese: 这时他的目光汇聚到床头柜上一页皱皱巴巴的宣传单。

sentences.english: She groped for her glasses on the bedside table.
sentences.chinese: 她伸手在床头柜上摸索着寻找她的眼镜。

sentences.english: I had left a note on the night table.
sentences.chinese: 我在床头柜上留了一张纸条。

definition: small side table/coffee table/teapoy (ornamental tripod with caddies for tea)
sofa (loanword)/CL:條|条[tiao2],張|张[zhang1]/(Internet slang) the first reply or replier to a forum post
drawing room (room for arriving guests)/living room/CL:間|间[jian1]
